case_vignette: A 3-year-old boy is brought to the physician for the evaluation of recurrent skin lesions. The episodes of lesions started at the age of 2 months and multiple treatment options have been attempted without success. He has also had several episodes of respiratory tract infections, enlarged lymph nodes, and recurrent fevers since birth. The boy attends daycare. His older brother has asthma. The patient's immunizations are up-to-date. He is at the 5th percentile for length and 10th percentile for weight. He appears ill. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F), pulse is 100/min, and blood pressure is 100/60 mm Hg. Examination shows several raised, erythematous lesions of different sizes over the face, neck, groins, and extremities; some secrete pus. Cervical and axillary lymph nodes are enlarged bilaterally. The remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having recurring skin sores, fevers, and I've been getting sick with respiratory infections a lot.
How old are you?
I am 3 years old.
Are you currently on any medication?
Multiple treatments have been tried, but none have been successful.
Do you have a history of skin infections or other infections since birth?
Yes, I've had several episodes of respiratory tract infections and recurrent fevers since birth.
Do these symptoms occur after exposure to certain triggers or infections?
The symptoms started when I was 2 months old, but there's no mention of specific triggers in my case.
Has there been any weight loss or failure to thrive?
I am at the 10th percentile for weight for my age.
Do you have a family history of similar symptoms or immune system problems?
My older brother has asthma.
Have any immunological evaluations or genetic tests been conducted for you?
The vignette does not mention immunological evaluations or genetic tests.
Have you experienced any other symptoms or issues, such as bone pain or frequent bruising?
No, the remainder of the examination shows no abnormalities.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Granulomatous Disease (CGD)
